122 Poromac River BRIDGE

cost of $40,000 to cover the surveys and all line and grade work required
during the entire construction period, and to cover the cost of such special
inspection work and other engineering work as may be required in addition
to the complete engineering services covered in the contract between the
State Roads Commission and J. E. Greiner Company.
Total Engineering, Architectural, and other Technical
Service Fees. .. ... .. ... . ... ... SRR $298 ,000

E. Legal, Administrative, and Overhead Expenses

The legal, administrative, and overhead expenses, herein listed, are in-
tended to cover the expenses of the State Roads Commission during the en-
tire period, with the exception of those listed under ¢Preliminary Expenses.”’
These expenses begin with the preliminary engineering work and extend
through the entire period until the final completion of the construction work
and the closing out of the construction fund. The legal expenses will con-
sist principally of legal work in connection with the acquisition of the neces-
sary rights-of-way, which can be handled largely as a matter of routine
work, but which may require the services of special counsel and legal assist-
ance to the extent herein estimated.

The administrative and overhead expenses are not intended to include
the routine administration or work which can be done by the personnel
regularly engaged in the routine work of the State Roads Commission.
It is, however, intended to represent an estimate of special administrative
services which may be required in addition to the regular personnel of the
Commission. See Table 52.





TABLE 52
Legal, Administrative and Overhead Expenses
Special Legal Services during Construction............ ... .. . ... . . . . it $15,000
Administrative and Overhead EXpenses............ ...ttt 10,000
Total Legal, Administrative, and Overhead Expenses..................................... $25,000



Summary of Quantities Comprising the Complete Construction Work

A complete summary of the quantities comprising the complete construc-
tion of the substructure, divided to show the quantities included in the con-
struction of each of the abutments, the pile trestle, and piers 1 to 20 inclu-
sive, is tabulated in Table 53.
